intro: Amoebophyllum angustum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf amoebophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. It is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetland habitats. Amoebophyllum angustum is a relatively small plant, typically growing to a height of less than 1 meter.
